gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.intro: Mini CRM is a simple, local-first CRM to keep track of leads, contacts, and interactions.
bullets: Open Preferences to toggle dark mode and manage backups.
Use Contacts to save people and companies you speak to.
Use Leads to track opportunities and set a Next Action Date for follow-ups.
Use Timeline to log calls, emails, meetings, and notes.
Dashboard shows items due today, overdue, quick stats, and recent activity.
notes: All data is stored locally in your browser (LocalStorage). Export regularly.

leads.title: Leads
leads.intro: Leads represent opportunities (a project, a deal, or any potential sale).
bullets: Click Add Lead to create a new lead with title, company, optional linked contact, stage, value, and Next Action Date.
Set a Next Action Date to make the lead appear in Dashboard sections.
Stages include New, Contacted, Qualified, Won, and Lost.
Edit any lead from the Leads list; updates save instantly to local storage.

contacts.title: Contacts
contacts.intro: Contacts are people you talk to. You can attach a contact to a lead.
bullets: Click Add Contact and fill in the basics (name, email, phone, company, position).
Use tags like vip or repeat to group customers.
Edit contact details anytime; changes reflect wherever the contact is referenced.

interactions.title: Interactions & Timeline
interactions.intro: Log calls, emails, meetings, and notes in Timeline. Optionally link them to a lead or a contact.
bullets: Add Interaction and pick a type. Link to Lead or Contact for context.
Set Next Action Date on an interaction to update that lead’s follow-up date.
Filter by type or by linked entity to focus the list.
notes: Timeline is ordered by most recent first.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
bullets: Due Today lists leads whose Next Action Date equals today.
Overdue shows leads with a past Next Action Date.
Quick Stats summarizes lead counts by stage.
Recent Interactions shows the latest activity across leads and contacts.

preferences.title: Preferences
bullets: Toggle dark mode.
Export JSON to download a complete backup.
Import JSON to restore a backup.
Use testing utilities to seed demo data or create quick due/overdue items.

importExport.title: Import and Export
importExport.intro: Your data is yours. Back it up and restore it easily.
bullets: Export JSON creates a single file containing leads, contacts, and interactions.
Import JSON replaces your current data with the file you choose.
Clear Data removes all local records to reset the app.
notes: If the File System Access API is not supported in your browser, downloads still work via a standard file save.

faq.q: Why does Dashboard say Nothing due today?
faq.a: Because no lead has a Next Action Date equal to today. Set a lead’s Next Action Date or use Preferences → Testing Utilities to add a lead due today.
All data lives in your browser’s LocalStorage. Use Export JSON regularly to keep manual backups.

faq.q: Can I link multiple contacts to a lead?
faq.a: This mini-app links a single primary contact per lead for simplicity.

faq.q: How do I mark a deal as won or lost?
faq.a: Edit the lead and change the Stage to Won or Lost.

faq.q: What happens when I set Next Action Date on an interaction?
faq.a: If the interaction is linked to a lead, the lead’s Next Action Date is updated to match.

privacy.title: Your Data & Privacy
privacy.intro: This app does not send your data to a server.
bullets: Everything is stored locally in your browser.
You control backups with Export/Import JSON.
